title: Memoir of George Wilson ...
author: Wilson, Jessie A.
snippet: A certain amount of pleasurable sympathy in the associations with ancient scenes and picturesque ruins is also a common feeling with boys ; and frequently a Saturday's ramble had for its special goal, Old Woodhouselee, Roslin. Chapel, Niddry Castle, Preston Tower, or some other of the storied ruins around Edinburgh, associated with the names of Wallace, Bothwell, Queen Mary, etc. One of our boyish wonders was to watch, from Arthur's Seat, the slow progress of the railway tunnel, which at length forced its way through the solid trap rock, and admitted of Edinburgh's first railway entering the town.

title: The manuscripts of His Grace the Duke of Portland, preserved at Welbeck abbey ...
snippet: Two miles farther is Preston Tower, belonging likewise to Mr. Wood.
